result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth L. Bartnik was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence is imposed and stayed, if imposed defendant has 60 days to pay any outstanding financial obligations as ordered by the Court.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections, as is required in all criminal convictions. Costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.

The defendant shall attend counseling as directed by the agent, and shall make all counseling records available to the Department of Corrections.  The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.  Defendant was ordered to report immediately to the probation and parole office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth L. Bartnik
